results.title: Pilkington Brothers offer: the best of both worlds
results.creator_credit: Frank Worth, Cecil Musk and British Information Services

video_links.name: Pilkington Brothers offer: the best of both worlds

results.brief_description: Two visitors from outer space visit Earth in order to investigate a material unknown on their planet - glass. They are shown the many architectural uses of glass and the many varieties which are available for use.

results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Swiss Society for Combating Cancer
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.

results.title: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]
results.creator_credit: Norman Mackay, Harry Leaman and Helms Athletic Foundation

video_links.name: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]

results.brief_description: Documentary film on the Olympic Winter Games in Cortina in the Italian Alps, 1956. Sets the panoramic views of Cortina and the venues where the 1956 Winter games will be held whilst highlighting the previous 1952 Oslo Winter games with footage of specific events. Also includes footage of Melbourne in 1956 featuring the Melbourne Cricket Ground and St Kilda Town Hall and images of the 1952 Summer games in Helsinki. Narrated by Fred Hessler.
results.title_for_label: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]

results.title: Trip to Mars
results.brief_description: Magical animation details the extraterrestial adventures of hand-drawn harlequin, Koko the clown. Reluctant astronaut Koko inadvertantly launches Mr. Fleischer skyward and the two conclude their supernatural reverie in a ‘taxi-crab’ flung to the rings of Saturn. Koko’s martian odyssey reveals a wealth of unlikely and outlandish natives.

results.title: Sprints
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Gives coaching tips for sprints events from Olympic athletes and coaches, plus footage of sprints events from the Moscow Olympics.

results.title: The Consequences of nuclear war
results.creator_credit: Ross Christopher and Australian National University
results.brief_description: Highlights of a conference, with the same name as the title, which was held at the Australian National University. The papers dealt with various aspects of the nuclear arms race and were presented by a range of Australian and international speakers.

results.title: Compilation Ultimate skills
results.brief_description: Ultimate skills (Australia): Three motorcycle champions explain and demonstrate their skills at trail riding, motocross and road riding. 2.” Survival of the fastest” (U.K.): Shows the evolution of the motorcycle from a primitive machine into a glamorous, sophisticated piece of engineering. Looks at research and development and compares British and Japanese bikes.

results.title: The Sydney Opera House Tenth Anniversary Recital: Roger Woodward
results.creator_credit: Peter Skillman, Peter Abbott and Yoho Productions
results.brief_description: Roper Woodward played the first recital at the Sydney Opera House in 1973 and ten years later he was given the honour of performing the tenth anniversary recital on October 1, 1983. This video presents Roger Woodward performing the commemorative tenth recital live at the Sydney Opera House playing three of Beethoven’s sonatas and ending with an encore of Chopin’s Grand Waltz.

results.title: Compilation The Angel and the rat
results.brief_description: The Angel and the rat (Melbourne, dir. Steve McDonald): Examines the ideas and lifestyle of Smiley Williams, a young sculptor. “Heart, head and hand” (dir. Peter Weir): Scenes from the life and work of Australian potter, Peter Rushforth. “Natural glass” (N.Z. dir. John King ; prod. Derek Wright); Looks at a one-man revival of natural glassmaking in New Zealand.

results.title: Bitter medicine = Medicina amara
results.creator_credit: Sabina Wynn, Jessica Douglas-Henry and Leichardt Women's Community Health Centre
results.brief_description: Bitter medicine explores the personal experiences of migrant women in Australia and their use of tranquillisers. Through a dramatised reconstruction the video explores reasons that compel women to seek help and the common medical response. This video suggests alternatives to medication and presents migrant women’s personal experiences and their determination to face a pill-free life.
